meta.description: Language labels for module "tools_txicsutopiaM2" fake database

languageKey.label: The page where the site templates are created.
Comma-separated list of the back-end user templates. A user is defined by its id and its role joigned by an hyphen.
The group id used as a template for the created users main group.
Name of the main storage folder which exists in each template.
Create frontend user counterpart for backend users.
Name of the main frontend group where to put users into. This group have to exists in each template.
The order of the extension forms in the creation course.
The comma-separated list of the disabled extensions.
The template file used to notify the administrator about a new site. Translation can be guessed using language extension (ie. .fr or .en).
The subject template for the notification mail sent to the administrator. Usual translation can be used.
The template file used to notify the requester about the acceptance of his site. Translation can be guessed using language extension (ie. .fr or .en).
The subject template for the acceptance notification mail sent to the requester. Usual translation can be used.
The template file used to notify the requester about the rejection of his site. Translation can be guessed using language extension (ie. .fr or .en).
The subject template for the rejection notification mail sent to the requester. Usual translation can be used.
The comma-separated list of UTOPIA's administrators uids.
fileadmin/ relative path where to save the requests.
fileadmin/ relative path where to save accepted requests.

fileadmin/ relative path where the root of the site templates are. The match is done by path segment. An empty path segment (nothing between two slashes) means the name is not relevant. A not empty one means must match. When this root match, it is replaced by the new root.
fileadmin/ relative path where to save the site specific files. If no ###TITLE### marker is found, the title is appended to the path.
The sysfolder page where to import sites.
Comma-separated list of the static tables set to define when exporting site templates.
